The original, long term goal was to be able to choose any combination of software between the GNU/Linux and BSD versions, but that is no longer a priority, as it is not feasible at this point in time.
The original, long term goal was to be able to choose any combination of software between the GNU/Linux and BSD versions, but that is no longer a priority, as it is not feasible at this point in time.
â
FreeBSD system ebuilds are integrated into the main portage tree, but this port is far from being complete due to the amount of packages needing to be ported and the lack of a proper LiveCD (right now, [[FreeSBIE]]'s LiveCD or FreeBSD setup CD are used during installation).
+
FreeBSD system ebuilds are integrated into the main portage tree, but this port is far from being complete due to the amount of packages needing to be ported and the lack of a proper Live CD (right now, [[FreeSBIE]]'s Live CD or FreeBSD setup CD are used during installation).
